item.title: Changeset [1829]: List broken themes and suggest corrective action.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: List broken themes and suggest corrective action.

item.title: Ticket #410 (post via mail) created
item.dc:creator: davidcrickett
item.description:
If you use this trick, then you don't get the noop error anymore:

To fix, edit wp-includes/class-pop3.php, and change this line:

if($this->RFC1939) {

to this:

if(!$this->RFC1939) {

(add exclamation point).

...but this instead:

Fatal error: Call to undefined function: logio() in /hotel/yoursite/WWW/wp-includes/functions-post.php on line 170

item.title: Ticket #408 (Count of posts for categories includes 'future-date' posts.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: If you save an article with a date in the future in order to have that post post on a specific date (Holloween, Labor Day, Birthday, 2nd of May, whenever...) that post is included in the count of articles in the categories block.

item.title: Ticket #407 (import-mt.php does not recognise breaks between entries) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I tried importing an MT dump to 1.3 and instead of importing the entries separately they were all lumped together in one post.

There seemed to have been some kind of filter run on the text converting the hyphens in the entry breaks to em dashes.

The same file imported into 1.2 correctly.

item.title: Ticket #406 (Add "Edit" option to Plugin page) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
I like how you can edit plugins directly by going to Presentation -> Other Files -> plugin_file.php

It would be nice if on the Plugins page there was an "edit" link for each plugin that also did this.

item.title: Ticket #393 (Call to undefined function: get_admin_page_title()) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Recent links will need to be updated to work with 1.3.

item.title: Ticket #405 (Trackback title format bungs up HTML entities) created
item.dc:creator: offline
item.description:
When tracking back to one of my own entries, I noticed the following:

I get a text string as a title that looks like this as the final output:

Offlingblog » Blog Archive » <title>

What's happening is the leading ampersand in the raquo; entity is being converted to an & entity before tracking back, which is probably not the desired behaviour.

item.title: Ticket #393 (Call to undefined function: get_admin_page_title()) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Using CVS as of 14:00 on 22nd, I get this error when using the bookmarklet associated with the 'Recent Links' plugin from â€‹http://rebelpixel.com/projects/wp-recent-links/ --Podz

item.title: Ticket #353 (Wordpress thinks the index page is a 404 page) updated
item.dc:creator: offline
item.description:
Well, this is still happening in the latest (Oct 22, 18:24 PM MST) CVS version.

It occurs with both www.offlineblog.com and offlineblog.com (I thought it might have something to do with the url, but no go)

I'm still hoping someone can tell me what info they'd need to track this down.
